intro: Pappophorum aucheri, commonly known as Persian windgrass, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white florets surrounded by bracts, and its inflorescence is typically composed of a dense cluster of flowers. Pappophorum aucheri is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
